info.title: RPC - Wireless Operations
info.description:
Cisco IOS-XE RPC Operations - Wireless

**Category:** Wireless Operations
**Modules:** 8
**RPC Actions:** 151

**HTTP Methods:**
- POST: Execute RPC action/operation

**Modules Included:**
- wireless
- wireless-access-point
- wireless-ble-mgmt
- wireless-client
- wireless-mesh
- wireless-rogue-authz
- wireless-rrm
- wireless-tech-support

**RPC Operation Pattern:**
RPC operations are executed via RESTCONF POST to `/operations/` endpoints.
Each RPC accepts input parameters and returns output results.

**Example RPC Execution:**
```bash
POST /restconf/operations/Cisco-IOS-XE-rpc:ping
Content-Type: application/yang-data+json

{
  "input": {
    "ping-request": {
      "destination": "10.0.0.1",
      "repeat-count": 5,
      "size": 100
    }
  }
}
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "output": {
    "ping-reply": {
      "destination": "10.0.0.1",
      "request-count": 5,
      "reply-count": 5,
      "success-rate": 100,
      "minimum-rtt": 1,
      "average-rtt": 2,
      "maximum-rtt": 3
    }
  }
}
```

**Common Operations:**
- wireless_access_point_cfg_rpc:set-ap-vlan-tag
- wireless_access_point_cfg_rpc:set-ap-vlan-tag-all
- wireless_access_point_cfg_rpc:set-ap-monitor-mode-chnl-optimize
- wireless_access_point_cfg_rpc:set-ap-mode
- wireless_access_point_cfg_rpc:set-lrad-led-state
...

**Source Module:** wireless-access-point

Configure VLAN tagging for non-bridge AP

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/wireless_access_point_cfg_rpc:set-ap-vlan-tag-all`

vlan-id.description: Configure VLAN ID. VLAN ID 0 will disable VLAN tagging for all non-bridge APs

post.summary: New channel using 802.11h channel announcement
post.description:
**Source Module:** wireless-access-point

New channel using 802.11h channel announcement

chan.description:
Channel number
         1 - 173: Dual band
         1 - 14: 2.4 GHz
         36 - 173: 5 Ghz
         1 - 233 : 6 Ghz

slot-id.description: Slot ID of AP to configure new channel

ap-name.description: Name of AP to configure channel number

mac-addr.description: MAC address of AP to configure channel number

post.summary: Configures the external antenna gain of AP
post.description:
**Source Module:** wireless-access-point

Configures the external antenna gain of AP

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/wireless_access_point_cfg_rpc:set-ap-slot-ext-antenna-gain`

external-antenna-gain.description: External antenna gain value in multiple of .5 decibel isotropic units (i.e. An integer value 4 means 4 x 0.5 = 2 decibel isotropic units of gain)

slot-id.description: Slot ID of AP to configure the external antenna gain. Valid value range is 0-3

band.description:
Radio frequency band to configure external antenna gain.
         1 - 2.4 GHz
         2 - 5 GHz
         3 - Dual band
         4 - 6 Ghz

ap-name.description: Name of AP to configure the external antenna gain

mac-addr.description: MAC address of AP to configure the external antenna gain

band.description:
Current band of AP
         1 - 2.4 GHz
         2 - 5 GHz
         3 - Dual band

Mode of an AP radio slot
         1 - Local
         2 - Monitor
         4 - Sniffer

sub-mode.description:
Sub Mode of an AP radio slot
         0 - None
         1 - Auto
         2 - Manual

chan.description:
Channel to be sniffed
         1 - 165: Dual band
         1 - 14: 5 GHz
         36 - 165: 2.4 Ghz

ap-name.description: Name of AP to configure the radio role

mac-addr.description: MAC address of AP to configure the radio role

post.summary: FRA configuration
post.description:
**Source Module:** wireless-access-point

FRA configuration

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/wireless_access_point_cfg_rpc:fra-revert-data`

fra-revert-auto-only.description:
TRUE : Revert only XOR radios currently in automatic band selection.
         FALSE : Revert all XOR radios

fra-revert-mode.description:
TRUE:  Put XOR radios in automatic band selection.
         FALSE: Put XOR radios in static 2.4GHz/5GHz/6GHz band

band.description:
Current band of AP
         1 - 2.4 GHz
         2 - 5 GHz
         3 - Dual band
         4 - 6 GHz

Current band of AP

New band to switch AP to from current band

post.description:
**Source Module:** wireless-access-point

Configure slot admin state

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/wireless_access_point_cfg_rpc:set-ap-slot-admin-state`

mode.description: Mode of AP to configure admin state

slot-id.description:
AP slot ID to configure admin state
          Allowed slot ID for bands are
            1 - slot ID 0
            2 - slot ID 1 and slot ID 2
            3 - slot ID 0 and slot ID 2
            4 - slot ID 2 and slot ID 3

band.description:
Radio frequency band of AP to configure admin state.
          1 - 2.4 GHz
          2 - 5 GHz
          3 - Dual band
          4 - 6 GHz

ap-name.description: Name of AP to configure admin state

mac-addr.description: MAC address of AP to configure admin state

tertiary-wlc-name.description: Optionally configure tertiary controller on the APs

post.summary: Configure Open RRM Tx Power Parameters for AP Radio
post.description:
**Source Module:** wireless-access-point

Configure Open RRM Tx Power Parameters for AP Radio

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/wireless_access_point_cmd_rpc:set-open-rrm-tx-power-auto`

slot-id.description: Slot ID for the Radio to which TX Power has to be applied

band.description: Band ID, 2.4GHz or 5 GHz of the Radio Slot, to which Tx Parameters to be changed

tx-power.description: Transmit Power in dBm specific to the Radio slot

rrm-6ghz-lpi-max.description: This is a recommendation from TPC to notify that Required Tx power is more than max possible in LPI mode

ap-name.description: AP name that holds this radio which TX Power parameters to be changed

mac-addr.description: Radio MAC address of AP to which TX Power parameters to be changed

post.summary: Configure Open RRM Channel Parameters for AP Radio
post.description:
**Source Module:** wireless-access-point

Configure Open RRM Channel Parameters for AP Radio

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/wireless_access_point_cmd_rpc:set-open-rrm-channel-auto`

slot-id.description: Slot ID for the Radio to which channel change has to be applied

band.description: Band ID, 2.4GHz, 5 GHz or 6 Ghz of the Radio Slot, to which channel has to be changed

extension-chan.description: Extension channel number when the channel width is greater than 20MHz channel

curr-cost-metric.description: DCA cost metric for the current channel

new-cost-metric.description: DCA cost metric for the new channel

secondary-chan-1.description: Extended 40MHz third channel when the channel width is greater than 40MHz channel

secondary-chan-2.description: Extended 40MHz fourth channel when the channel width is greater than 40MHz channel

chan-width.description: Channel width number 20 for 20MHz, 40 for 40MHz, 80 for 80MHz, 160 for 160 MHz and 188 for 80 plus 80MHz

second-best-chan.description: Second best channel number as recommended by DCA

second-best-width.description: Second best channel width number 20 for 20MHz, 40 for 40MHz, 80 for 80MHz, 160 for 160 MHz and 188 for 80 plus 80MHz

second-best-metric.description: DCA Cost metric for the second best channel

rrf-metric.description: Radios's coverage overlap rate(%) by FRA, 0 to 100

rrf-contributing.description: Radio is contributing to redundant radio

dca-chan-width.description: Configured RRM DCA Channel width number 20 for 20MHz, 40 for 40MHz, 80 for 80MHz, 160 for 160 MHz and 188 for 80 plus 80MHz

slave-chan.description: The current channel of the slave radio

slave-metric.description: DCA cost metric of the slave channel

best-channel-lpi.description: Channel number to be applied to Low Power Indoor

best-width-lpi.description: Channel width number for Low Power Indoor

best-rssi-metric-lpi.description: DCA Cost metric for the second best channel to Low Power Indoor

second-best-channel-lpi.description: Second Best channel number to be applied to Low Power Indoor

second-best-width-lpi.description: Second best channel width number for Low Power Indoor

second-rssi-metric-lpi.description: Second Best DCA Cost metric for the second best channel to Low Power Indoor

best-channel-sp.description: Channel number to be applied to Standard Power Mode

best-width-sp.description: Channel width number for Standard Power Mode

best-rssi-metric-sp.description: DCA Cost metric for the second best channel to Standard Power Mode

second-best-channel-sp.description: Second Best channel number to be applied to Standard Power Mode

second-best-width-sp.description: Second best channel width number for Standard Power Mode

second-rssi-metric-sp.description: Second Best DCA Cost metric for the second best channel to Standard Power Mode

rlp-sp-pwrmode-switch.description: This is a recommendation to do power mode switch from LPI mode to SP mode

sp-chan-low-pwr.description: 6 GHz Radio operating in LPI mode as SP channel allowed txpower is not more than max txpower in LPI mode

ap-name.description: AP name that holds this radio to which channel parameters to be changed

mac-addr.description: Radio MAC address of AP to which channel parameters to be changed

post.summary: Remote Leader Reset Remote Control Procedure resets the rrm group state from remote-member-state to its pre remote-member-state immediately, as opposed to the heartbeat timer which resets after the timer expires.
post.description:
**Source Module:** wireless-rrm

Remote Leader Reset Remote Control Procedure resets the rrm group state from remote-member-state to its pre remote-member-state immediately, as opposed to the heartbeat timer which resets after the timer expires.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/wireless_rrm_rpc:rrm-rldr-reset`

enable-6ghz.description: Flag to set remote leader for 6ghz

post.summary: Remote Leader Heart Beat Remote Control Procedure sets the heart beat timer to the device. Until this timer expires the device will continue in remote member state. Any new timer value will replace the old timer. If there is no new heartbeat timer value before this timer expires, device will reset to original pre rrm-remote-group state.
post.description:
**Source Module:** wireless-rrm

Remote Leader Heart Beat Remote Control Procedure sets the heart beat timer to the device. Until this timer expires the device will continue in remote member state. Any new timer value will replace the old timer. If there is no new heartbeat timer value before this timer expires, device will reset to original pre rrm-remote-group state.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/wireless_rrm_rpc:rrm-rldr-heartbeat`

post.summary: Remote Leader Set Remote Control Procedure
post.description:
**Source Module:** wireless-rrm

Remote Leader Set Remote Control Procedure

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/wireless_rrm_rpc:rrm-rldr-set`

enable-6ghz.description: Flag to set remote leader for 6ghz

post.summary: RPC message for tech-support wireless archive generation
post.description:
**Source Module:** wireless-tech-support

RPC message for tech-support wireless archive generation

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/wireless_tech_support_rpc:tech-support-wireless-archive`

archive.description:
Tech-support wireless archive generate option
         if this option is marked as 'true' tech-support wireless archive will be generated
         The tech support wireless file included in the archive will be equivalent
         to the output of command 'show tech-support wireless'

file-name.description:
File name of the tech-support wireless archive/file that will be generated. If
         the file-name is empty, it indicates that there was failure in the
         operation, possibly an internal error or another operation was being
         processed. In such cases, the reason for failure will also be
         attached to the response message. The arrival of response does not
         indicate that the operation is complete because the tech-support wireless
         operation takes a huge amount of time to complete and notifications
         related to the execution can be consumed by subscribing to the tech-support
         event notification model which will contain the same file-name found in this
         response message.

post.summary: RPC message for tech-support wireless file generation
post.description:
**Source Module:** wireless-tech-support

RPC message for tech-support wireless file generation

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/wireless_tech_support_rpc:tech-support-wireless-file`

wireless-info.description: This option will collect output of 'show tech-support wireless' command into a file

file-name.description:
File name of the tech-support wireless archive/file that will be generated. If
         the file-name is empty, it indicates that there was failure in the
         operation, possibly an internal error or another operation was being
         processed. In such cases, the reason for failure will also be
         attached to the response message. The arrival of response does not
         indicate that the operation is complete because the tech-support wireless
         operation takes a huge amount of time to complete and notifications
         related to the execution can be consumed by subscribing to the tech-support
         event notification model which will contain the same file-name found in this
         response message.
